intro: Lithocarpus papillifer, commonly known as the papillate tanoak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, woody fruits and evergreen leaves. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Vietnam and Thailand. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters, with a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive papillate (bumpy) texture on the underside, giving it its common name. The fruit is a坚果 (nut) enclosed in a thick, woody husk, which splits open to release the edible seed.
